metadata.title: CVE-2019-9513 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to resource loops, potentiallyleading to a denial of service. The attacker creates multiple requeststreams and continually shuffles the priority of the streams in a way thatcauses substantial churn to the priority tree. This can consume excess CPU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip2 - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-common - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-core - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-extras - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-full - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-light - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnghttp2-14 - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2 - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-client - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-proxy - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-server - 1.39.2-1
No subscription required

libnode108 - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
nodejs - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.1-0ubuntu1').
nghttp2 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.39.2-1').
nodejs package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2').
